case_vignette:
A 17-year-old boy is brought to the physician by his mother because of increasingly withdrawn behavior for the last two years. His mother reports that in the last 2–3 years of high school, her son has spent most of his time in his room playing video games. He does not have any friends and has never had a girlfriend. He usually refuses to attend family dinner and avoids contact with his siblings. The patient states that he prefers being on his own. When asked how much playing video games means to him, he replies that “it's okay.” When his mother starts crying during the visit, he appears indifferent. Physical and neurologic examinations show no other abnormalities. On mental status examination, his thought process is organized and logical. His affect is flattened.  A) Schizophrenia, B) Major Depressive Disorder, C) D) Other specified mental disorder, E) Not elsewhere classified.
The correct answer is A) Schizophrenia. The patient's lack of motivation, social withdrawal, and lack of interest in activities that he used to enjoy are all symptoms of schizophrenia. The patient's flattened affect and lack of emotional response to his mother's tears are also consistent with schizophrenia. The patient's thought process is organized and logical, which is not typical of schizophrenia. However, the patient's symptoms are not severe enough to meet the full criteria for schizophrenia, so the diagnosis is Other Specified Schizophrenia Spectrum and Other Psychotic Disorders.

Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I've been feeling increasingly withdrawn for the last two years and spend most of my time in my room playing video games. I don't really have any friends or a romantic relationship, and I prefer being on my own. Additionally, I usually refuse to attend family dinners and avoid contact with my siblings.
How old are you?
I am 17 years old.
Do you experience any other feelings such as persistent sadness, hopelessness, or lack of interest in activities you previously enjoyed?
I don't have any interest in activities that I used to enjoy.
Have you noticed any changes in your sleep pattern, appetite, or energy levels?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my sleep pattern, appetite, or energy levels.
Do you have any history of mental health issues, either personally or in your family?
The information provided does not mention any personal or family history of mental health issues.
Final Diagnosis: Schizoid Personality Disorder
